intro: Sersalisia galactoxylon, commonly known as the white wood tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its smooth, white bark and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its wood is prized for its lightweight and durability, making it useful in construction and furniture-making. The plant also has medicinal properties, with some traditional uses reported in local herbal remedies.
